{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3484941,"name":"Sean","username":"Skimonster110","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skimonster110/{size}/261842_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-16T20:57:18.149Z","cooked":"

I’m on a rookie team and im having an issue with the new radios after pushing a firmware updata. The system light is just blinking. I just tryed updateing it to this version.

173706091987456783396370537942381920×2560 331 KB

173706096902150153601261143536271920×2560 189 KB

Any help is appreciated

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-16T20:57:18.149Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":109,"readers_count":108,"score":56.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482134,"topic_slug":"radio-issues-help","display_username":"Sean","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/2025-radio-roborio-status-light/481975/5","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"2025 Radio RoboRio Status Light","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69545,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Electrical "},"post_url":"/t/radio-issues-help/482134/1","custom_user_title":"Electrical ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3484945,"name":"Scott W","username":"Programming4907","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/programming4907/{size}/168313_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-16T21:03:09.600Z","cooked":"

What firmware version does the sticker on the box say?

With the radio plugged into the ethernet port on your laptop, open a command prompt and use the ipconfig command and see what IP address was assigned by the radio to your laptop.

It might be 10.00.01.x or it might be 192.168.69.x

The output of ipconfig will also tell you the gateway, which should be the radio IP. Try putting that into a web browser.
